PSDcast

PSDcast (also known as Podcast) by Power Systems Design are moderated and produced by PSD's editorial staff.

PSDcast are audio interviews on relevant topics to the power electronics industry and are conducted with subject matter experts from the power electronics industry, academic institutions and relevant industry associations.

Please subscribe me to PSD's PSDcast Channel and keep me informed about of PSDcast activity

Subscribe Me
Current

Alex Stapleton, CCO at Alexander Battery Technologies

PSDcast – Resilience Drives a Renewed Focus on Energy Storage

08/20/2025

­As renewable energy like wind and solar has become more prominent, energy storage has become ever more critical. But recent incidents like the large-scale blackout in Spain and the recent one in L.A. have shifted the way companies view battery storage – for renewable energy and for business in general. And on the line to discuss that is our old friend Alex Stapleton, CCO at Alexander Battery Technologies.

Giampaolo Marino, Senior VP of Strategy and Business at Energous

PSDcast – A Wireless Sensor for the IoT

08/18/2025

­One of the most critical questions surrounding the Internet of Things is the myriad power requirements for all the devices that comprise this interconnected network of, for lack of a better words, everything. And along those lines, Energous Wireless Power Solutions recently launched the e-Sense tag, a battery-free, maintenance-free wireless sensor. And here to discuss that and why the next wave of IoT demands a new approach to power delivery – specifically wireless energy – is Giampaolo Marino, Senior VP of Strategy and Business at Energous.

Felix Kan, the CEO and founder of Cyberbay

PSDcast – The Science and Benefits of "Ethical Hacking"

06/30/2025

­You’ve probably heard the term “ethical hacking” or “white hat hacking,” as opposed to black hat hacking, which are, of course, malicious hacker who aim to infiltrate closed system, cause damage, commit theft, or just sow chaos. But ethical hacking has turned into quite the lucrative industry and a great counter to all the malevolent cyber criminals.

And on the line to discuss this phenomenon and his company is Felix Kan, the CEO and founder of Cyberbay.

Harry Soin from Advanced Energy

PSDcast - Data Center Power Demands

06/18/2025

­We’ve recently witnessed an exponential increase in data center power demands, driven largely by the equally monumental rise in generative AI. By one estimate, generative AI could add anywhere from $2.6 to 4.4 trillion dollars in global economic benefits annually, and so it’s no surprise that data center power consumption is set to more than triple through the end of the decade. And on the line to discuss that is Harry Soin from Advanced Energy.

PSDcast – Getting Closer to a Viable Fusion Power Plant

06/12/2025

­Nuclear fusion – the power of the sun. We’ve been tinkering with the idea for nearly a century – and in fact, we’ve been working towards fusion reactors since the 1940s, roundabout the same time as the Manhattan Project (take that as you will), though as of yet, we haven’t reached net power. But Type One Energy feels they’re right on the verge of a breakthrough. And on the line to discuss this is Chris Mowry, CEO at Type One Energy.

Patrick Wadden, the Global VP of Vicor's Automotive Business Unit

PSDcast – Active Suspension Systems in Electric Vehicles

06/04/2025

­One of the more interesting trends to emerge in the automotive landscape is the broader availability of active suspension systems.  While the idea, itself, was tossed around as far back as the 1950s, it didn’t become a thing until 80’s, though it was cost-prohibitive. And even today, being able to adjust suspension in real-time is mostly a luxury feature, though Hongfa and Vicor aim to change that.

And on the line to discuss that is Patrick Wadden, the Global VP of Vicor's Automotive Business Unit.

Mike IrIbeck from CSU’s NASA Robotic Mining Competition Team.

PSDcast – NASA Competition Presages a Sustainable Human Presence on the Moon

05/10/2022

­NASA’s Annual LUNABOTICS Competition is a very cool Artemis Student Challenge designed to educate college students in the application of the NASA Systems Engineering. Throughout the multi-semester, university-level engineering exercise, teams are tasked with designing and constructing a prototype robot that demonstrates the technologies required for a sustainable human presence on the Moon and other off-world locations with the goal of Earth independence using In-Situ Resource Utilization technologies.

As they’ve done for several years now, Allied Electronics & Automation is sponsoring Colorado State University’s NASA Robotic Mining Competition Team in the 2022 LUNABOTICS Competition, and it’s a privilege to learn more about this very cool event.

PSDcast – Will Autonomous Air Taxis Deploy Before Autonomous Cars?

05/05/2022

­Because of the imperfection of the autonomous systems, but more importantly, the unpredictability of human drivers, fully self-driving vehicles have been slow to deploy in larger numbers. But what about an arena – the sky – with no pedestrians and no other vehicles aside from low-flying planes? Take all that unpredictably out of the equation, and you have a much more attractive prospect – which is likely why autonomous air taxis have gained so much traction as of late. Here to discuss that is professor Naira Hovakimyan from the University of Illinois’ Department of Mechanical Science and Engineering department.

PSDcast – A Wireless Battery Management System

01/15/2021

Electric vehicles rely on battery management systems to maximize their power, range, and efficiency. Every battery cell in the EV has to be wired to a BMS, and since more cells means a higher charge capacity – leading to a longer electric range – manufacturers pack as cells in there as they can. And that many cells wired directly to the battery management system creates practicality issues, so a wireless battery management system is preferable....
